data.title: Kannada Tv Serial Mayamruga
data.meta_description: Mayamruga is a Kannada Television Serial, Read The Synopsis, Episodes, Cast & Crew with Character names and Original names
data.text:
Pallavi Arun, from Karnataka, India, is a singer. She is a multi-faceted personality who is involved in playback singing, acting as well as anchoring. Her most important achievement was the Karnataka State Film Award for the Best Playback Singer in 2006 and 2007 for her song "Nodayya Kwate Lingave" in the film "Duniya". Pallavi started studying Hindustani classical at a very young age and continued it in Bangalore under Pandit Rajbhau Sontakke who was a disciple of Pandit Omkarnath Thakur of the Gwalior Gharana. She also got trained in Sugama Sangeeth under Mysore Ananthaswamy and Sri Raju Ananthaswamy. She is a young, vibrant and talented person who has acting skill along with her musical ability. Her introduction to the theater was when she worked on the productions for her grandfather, A. S.Murthy. She also worked as the faculty member in many theater workshops and is involved in the production of many street plays.

...

Malavika Avinash is a South Indian film actress, notable television serial performer and an acclaimed anchor. She was born to N Ganesan and Savithri. Her mother was a famous writer, an acclaimed vocalist and an accomplished dancer. She started learning Bharatanatyam even from her school days. She also learned Sitar in her early teen ages. Her entry into the profession of acting came as a surprise when the famous director G V Iyer happened to see her dancer concert and made note of her. He gave her a chance as Krishna in his movie “Krishnavathar” and it was a colossal success. Following it she performed in a children’s movie “Nakkalla Raajakumari” directed by Prema Karanth’s and it received grant recognition.

She took her graduation in Bachelor of Law at Banglore University with 3rd rank. She married a national and state award winning actor Avinash.

She then acted in the award winning Malayalam film by director Lenin Rajendran. However later she turn her attention to Mini screen industry which gave her extreme adoration than ever before. Her famous works are “Mayamruga’, “Baduku Jataka Bandi on Zee Kannada” a family story, “Nilavai Pidippom” a Tamil melodrama, “Pudhuyugam” a nice comedy serial, “Pralayam” a hilarious serial, and a amusing “Comedy colony” under the direction of Balachander. Her most adored performance during recent times is “Chellamay” where she played the protagonist role of Muththazhagi. A movie based on the death of the former Indian Prime Minister Rajiv Gandhi, “Cyanide” was other notable performance. Malavika also thrilled the Kannada audience with her appearance as a sturdy IPS police officer in “Mukhtha”.

Malavika is not a character who is known only in film circles. She campaigned for Sushma Swaraj in 1999 in Bellary. She joined BJP in 2013 and now play an active role in politics.

Malavika Avinash is now a contestant of BIg Boss Kannada Season 4.

...

Shivaji Jadhav is a Kannada actor who was born in Bangalore, Karnataka. So far Shivaji Jadhav has worked amazingly in the entertainment industry and his artwork has been released in Telugu language movies as well. He completed his graduation and worked in a bakery. Gradually, he realised that his life was in acting, and being part of street plays was the first step. In his early life he and his friends formed a group called “Sneha Kalaniketana” and their first play was on the price rise issue that plagued the society during those days. His plays would always draw massive crowds in Mysuru and this gave young Shivaji the confidence to pursue a full-time course in Mysuru university. Talking about his career in the industry, Shivaji Rao Jadhav is an actor, best known for films like Prithvi (2010), Dhad Dhad (2003) and Gowdru (2004), etc. But what he felt more comfortable with, was the small screen.

...

Krishne Gowda is an Indian actor and humourist who is well known for his acting in the Kannada film and television industry. He is among the prominent personalities of the Sandalwood film industry. Apart from being an actor, he is also a producer and a writer. He completed his MA in Kannada from the University of Mysore. He is the Principal of ‘St Philomena’s College Mysuru.’ He soon got the opportunity to act in the film, he grabbed it and initiated his career in the film industry in 2000 from the action movie ‘Soorappa.’ Some of the movies in which his roles became popular are 'Mussanje Maathu' in 2008, 'Nigarva' in 2020, etc. He has also acted in the acclaimed TV program ‘Harate,’ which was telecasted on Uday TV. He was very fond of writing articles since childhood. He retired from the post of Principal after serving for thirty-four years. As soon as he retired, he introduced himself as a lyricist in the movie ‘Happy Birthday,’ which released in 2016. Also, he published his articles in three columns of ‘Jalada Kannu,’ which was released at a great event with the auspicious hands of Suttur Seer Sri Shivaratri Deshikendra Swamiji. Being a social activist, he has also organized numerous humorous shows for helping needy people. One of the show was ‘Hasya Lahari,’ which was conducted with the motive to provide free hearing aids to needy children. The actor has been selected as a brand ambassador of Swachh Survekshan 2020 due to his great popularity among people and enormous contribution towards society. Currently, he is being involved in various other activities, along with the acting for his upcoming movie ‘Arrabi Kadala Theeradalli.'

...

Sihi Kahi Chandru is a noted artist in Kannada films and television. He is also a producer, director, and a theatre personality noted for his famous comedy play Nee naa naadare Naa nee ne na?, an adaption of Shakespeare’s play The Comedy Of Errors. He was given this name after his TV serial Sihi Kahi aired on Doordarshan during 1986-87. His wife Sihi Kahi Geetha also acted in the serial. They played the role of husband and wife in the serial; the show was very popular among Kannada audiences as Doordarshan was the only means of entertainment in television those days. After then the success of the serial gave both Chandru and Geetha the name “Sihi Kahi Chandru” and “Sihi Kahi Geetha”. Sihi Kahi literally means – the collaboration of bitter and sweet, in the Kannada language. Soon after the end of the Sihi Kahi serial, love blossomed between the two actors and they got married in the year 1990. The couple has two daughters named Hitha and Kushi.

...

The two times national award winning actor for supporting roles Dattanna alias HG Dattatreya was working in Air Force, but was interested in acting. He is one of the actors, who are highly qualified and also held a position as a principal in the management academy of HAL. Acting was his passion and so, he continued to do films regardless of awards. Although awards are definitely an encouragement for the actor, but to continue his journey in over 90 films that spanned over 26 years is indeed a remarkable feat. Although he chose to take up supporting actor role or even in character roles, he is known for his versatile performances in Kannada film industry.

In many Kannada films, the central plot revolved around him, therefore, giving a greater satisfaction to this actor, who had underplayed his role as per the script always. HG Dattatreya had excelled in many movies, especially in Munnudi (2000) and Bharath Stores (2012) that fetched him a national award. For his effortless and natural performance of a small time grocery retailer in Kannada film Bharath Store, he was given a special jury award. Most of the actors in the tinsel town are not comfortable doing minor roles, but this actor has no qualms about it. He also impressed the Telugu audience with his performance in Thila Danam. His acting wooed audiences with brilliant performance in Kempe Gowda (2011). Many would have raised eyebrows at the decision of Dattanna to move towards tinsel town, but so far, he received applauds for his acting in many films. Known for his magnificent acting prowess in Kannada cinema, he has bagged many State film awards too and won an International award. In the years that followed after his journey from theater to Kannada screen, the actor has carved a niche for himself.

Besides grabbing the National Awards twice in 2003 and 2012, Dattareya had received the Best Actor Award in International Film Festival in Fiji in 2013. Dattareya’s performance in Neer Dose with “Jaggesh,” "Haripriya" and Suman Ranganathan is unforgettable. In 2017, he played in Srinivasa Kalyana, “Jilebi,” a comedy horror thriller, Prathima, “Raajakumara,” Tab, Kempirve and Hombanna. In 2018, he played in more than half a dozen films including a web series titled Joshelay. 2019 started with success for Dattareya through Jaggesh movie Premier Padmini. He played in the high budgeted multi-starrer Bollywood film, Mission Mangal with Akshay Kumar, Vidya Balan, Taapsee Pannu, Nithya Menen and Sonakshi Sinha, directed by Jagan Shakti.

Thanks to his underrated yet extremely sincere performances in half a dozen films. To sum up his acting ability, he had given strong proof of his acting talents holding his own against the biggest banners of Kannada cinema.

...

Avinash is a Kannada actor, who has starred in South Indian language films and notably in the Kannada, Telugu and Tamil film industries. Avinash completed Master of Arts in Literature from the Mysore University and began his Career as a lecturer of English. In the beginning of his career, he was very active in the English theater circuit in Bangalore. He was following theater during his college days and he got into films. Avinash has acted in more than 200 movies in his career. Avinash married lawyer turned actress Malavika, who was his co-star in the soap opera Mayamriga.

Avinash made his debut in the movie ‘Thrishoola’. Unfortunately, the movie was not released due to reasons. He was introduced to the Kannada film industry through another movie “Samyuktha”. His first notable role was as saint Madhvacharya in the movie Madhavacharya by G.V.Iyer. Some of the famous films in which he acted are Chinnari Mutha, Nishkarsha, Mathadaana, lockup death, Appu, Dweepa, Chigurida Kanasu, Apthamitra, Chandramukhi, and Amrithadhare. For over a period of years, Avinash with his exceptional acting steadily built a place for himself in the film industry. Avinash is much sought after supporting actor in the Kannada film industry.

He won many awards. Some awards are Karnataka State Award for Best Supporting Actor for Mathadaana, Suvarna Film awards for Best Performance in a negative role for Prithvi. SICA (South India Cinematographers Association) Award for best supporting actor for Singarava, Film fare Award for best supporting actor for Aptharakshaka. Avinash is a keen cricket enthusiast himself. He also actively takes parts in actor Vishnuvardhan's Snehaloka Cricket Team (SCT).

Another version of this Bio...

Avinash B. S. is a motion picture actor from India. He acts in Kannada films predominantly. Avinash was an entrepreneur by profession initially. But his love and passion for acting made him divert his energies in a different path. He has been looking forward to getting into films since a long time, but his business kept him from doing so. It has always been Avinash B. S.’s dream to get into the cinema industry. However, he was very busy with his former work. Along with having a packed schedule, he also did not have the correct knowledge of how to make his way into the industry.
